title: Where to Claim Robux you Earn in Pls Donate on Roblox

steps.title: Robux you earn is transferred to your account automatically.
steps.content: Robux you earn is transferred to your account automatically. However, there is a pending period for all transactions between players in Roblox. During this time, you will not have access to the Robux you earned. This is to review all transactions and prevent malicious or fraudulent activity. The pending period takes a minimum of 5 days and can last up to 30 days.

steps.title: You can claim offline donations from the Gifts menu in the game.
steps.content: You can claim offline donations from the Gifts menu in the game. To do so, launch Pls Donate in Roblox. Click the icon that resembles a pink gift box to the left. Alternatively, you can interact with a pink mailbox in the game. Click the icon that resembles an envelope in the upper-right corner of the menu. Then click Claim on any donations you received offline. [1] X Research source

steps.title: You can view your pending transactions on your Roblox account.
steps.content: You can view your pending transactions on your Roblox account. Use the following steps to do so: Go to the Roblox website . Click Log In in the upper-right corner and log in if you haven’t already. Click the Robux icon in the upper-right corner. Click My Transactions . Check your pending transactions.

steps.title: Both Pls Donate and Roblox take a cut of your donations.
steps.content: Both Pls Donate and Roblox take a cut of your donations. Roblox typically takes a 30% cut of transactions made in Roblox. Haz3mn, the developer of Pls Donate, also takes a 10% cut. In total, you get to keep about 60% of the Robux you earn in Pls Donate. [2] X Research source [3] X Research source For example, if someone donates 200 Robux to you, Roblox will take 60 Robux, the Haz3mn will take 20 Robux, and you keep 120 Robux.

steps.title: There may be a few reasons you are not getting any donations.
steps.content: There may be a few reasons you are not getting any donations. Consider the following: [4] X Research source You don’t have any products. You should have game passes or shirts to sell in your booth. The game passes can be for any world you have created. [5] X Research source Your sign doesn’t say anything. Your sign should clearly state what you are trying to raise Robux for (i.e., develop a game, make a YouTube video, develop products, purchase products, etc). Set a goal. It’s a good idea to set a goal when soliciting donations in Pls Donate. State how much you want to raise. This will encourage larger donations. Interact with other players. Have short conversations with other players in as many servers as possible. Try to get other players to check out your booth. Don’t immediately start asking them to donate. You don’t want to seem like you are begging. Let other players know what you are raising Robux for and try to get them to check out your booth. Use the voice chats on the servers.

steps.title: There are lots of things you can do to get more donations.
steps.content: There are lots of things you can do to get more donations. The following are a few examples: [6] X Research source Have products to sell . You should have game passes or shirts to sell in your booth. The game passes can be for any world you have created. [7] X Research source Create game passes with different increments . You should have at least one game pass for increments of 5, 10, 25, 50, 100, 250, 500, 1000, 10,000, and 100,000 Robux. Don’t create a game pass for 1 Robux. You won’t get any Robux after Roblox, and the game developer takes their cut. Create multiple game passes at lower increments so people can donate more than once, really quickly. For example, you can add three game passes for increments of 5, 10, 25, 50, and 100. State what you’re raising money for on your sign . A lot of players have an empty sign and wonder why they’re not getting any donations. Your sign should clearly state what you are trying to raise Robux for (i.e., develop a game, make a YouTube video, develop products, purchase products, etc). Set a goal . It’s a good idea to set a goal when soliciting donations in Pls Donate. State how much you want to raise. This will encourage larger donations. Have a unique booth . You can purchase different types of booths from the shop. Decorate your booth and try to have eye-catching text. Pick the booths on the ends, if possible . The best booths are the ones next to the live donor boards. If you can’t get those, try to get one of the ones next to the walkways on the ends of the rows. You will get more foot traffic this way. Try hopping between different servers , especially if your server doesn’t have many people. You will meet more people this way and have a chance to promote yourself. Interact with other players . Have short conversations with other players in as many servers as possible. Try to get other players to check out your booth. Don’t immediately start asking them to donate. You don’t want to seem like you are begging. Let other players know what you are raising Robux for and try to get them to check out your booth. Use the voice chats on the servers.

steps.title: There are different effects and animations depending on how much you donate.
steps.content: There are different effects and animations depending on how much you donate. The donation effects are as follows: [8] X Research source 1 to 1,000 Robux: Your name appears at the top of the live donations board. 10,000 to 99,000 Robux: Your name will appear at the top of the live donations board for longer, and a 10,000 blimp will appear. Fireworks will also appear on all servers. 100,000 to 999,000 Robux: The 100,000 nuke is launched in all servers. The nuke hits the ground and explodes. Day turns to night, and there are fireworks. 1,000,000 to 9,999,999 Robux: Day turns to night in all servers, and the donor’s avatar is shown hitting the ground with a massive blue hammer while blue meteors fall. 10,000,000 to 99,999,999 Robux: Day turns to night on all servers. The donor's avatar is shown rising above the ground in a pillar of purple light. The avatar then throws purple energy to the ground while fireworks explode all over.
